alert.note: Alert for Cecil (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 9:32PM EDT until July 02 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Maryland, including the following county: Cecil. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 932 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkton... Calvert... North East... Rising Sun... Zion... Pleasant Hill... Bay View... Lombard... Blake... Fair Hill... Andora... Cherry Hill... Farmington... Barksdale... Appleton... West Nottingham... Glen Westover... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
